alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Coffee County through 430 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, An expansive area of slow moving thunderstorms extended across west and central Coffee county, with the strongest storms along a line extending from near West Green to near Douglas to 8 miles north of Willacoochee. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Douglas, Broxton, Ambrose and West Green. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
